WebSocketStream.summary: NOTE Experimental The WebSocketStream interface of the {{domxref("WebSockets API", "WebSockets API", "", "nocode")}} is a promise-based API for connecting to a WebSocket server. It uses streams to send and receive data on the connection, and can therefore take advantage of stream backpressure automatically, regulating the speed of reading or writing to avoid bottlenecks in the application.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)

WebSocketStreamClose.summary:
NOTE Experimental The close() method of the
interface closes the WebSocket connection. The method optionally accepts an object containing a custom code and/or reason indicating why the connection was closed.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)

WebSocketStreamClosed.summary:
NOTE Experimental The closed read-only property of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that fulfills with an object once the socket connection is closed. The object contains the closing code and reason.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)

WebSocketStreamClosed.value: A promise, which fulfills with an object containing the following properties:The promise rejects if the WebSocket connection did not close cleanly (for a clean close, the associated TCP connection must be closed after the WebSocket closing handshake is completed).

WebSocketStreamOpened.summary:
NOTE Experimental The opened read-only property of the
interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that fulfills with an object once the socket connection is successfully opened. Among other features, this object contains a and a instance for receiving and sending data on the connection.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)

WebSocketStreamOpened.value: A promise, which fulfills with an object containing the following properties:The promise rejects if the WebSocket connection fails.

WebSocketStreamUrl.summary:
NOTE Experimental The url read-only property of the
interface returns the URL of the WebSocket server that the WebSocketStream instance was created with.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)

WebSocketStreamWebSocketStream.summary:
NOTE Experimental The WebSocketStream() constructor creates a new
object instance.

remarks.para: -WebSocketStream: integrating streams with the WebSocket API, developer.chrome.com (2020)
